   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of transport_opt() length_errors.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_length_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          parallel/1]).
   35: 
   36: %% diameter callbacks
   37: -export([peer_up/3,
   38:          peer_down/3,
   39:          pick_peer/5,
   40:          prepare_request/4,
   41:          handle_answer/5,
   42:          handle_error/5,
   43:          handle_request/3]).
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   46: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
   47: 
   48: %% ===========================================================================
   49: 
   50: -define(util, diameter_util).
   51: 
   52: -define(CLIENT, "CLIENT").
   53: -define(SERVER, "SERVER").
   54: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
   55: -define(HOST(Host, Realm), Host ++ [$.|Realm]).
   56: -define(DICT, diameter_gen_base_rfc3588).
   57: 
   58: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   59: -define(SERVICE(Name),
   60:         [{'Origin-Host', Name ++ "." ++ ?REALM},
   61:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
   62:          {'Host-IP-Address', [{127,0,0,1}]},
   63:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   64:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   65:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [?DIAMETER_APP_ID_COMMON]},
   66:          {application, [{dictionary, ?DICT},
   67:                         {module, ?MODULE},
   68:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
   69: 
   70: -define(SUCCESS,
   71:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_SUCCESS').
   72: -define(MISSING_AVP,
   73:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_MISSING_AVP').
   74: -define(INVALID_MESSAGE_LENGTH,
   75:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RESULT-CODE_INVALID_MESSAGE_LENGTH').
   76: 
   77: -define(LOGOUT,
   78:         ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
   79: 
   80: -define(L, atom_to_list).
   81: 
   82: %% ===========================================================================
   83: 
   84: suite() ->
   85:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 120}}].
   86: 
   87: all() ->
   88:     [parallel].
   89: 
   90: parallel(_Config) ->
   91:     run().
   92: 
   93: %% ===========================================================================
   94: 
   95: origin(exit)    -> 0;
   96: origin(handle)  -> 1;
   97: origin(discard) -> 2;
   98: 
   99: origin(0) -> exit;
  100: origin(1) -> handle;
  101: origin(2) -> discard.
  102: 
  103: %% ===========================================================================
  104: 
  105: run() ->
  106:     run([exit, handle, discard]).
  107: 
  108: run(List)
  109:   when is_list(List) ->
  110:     ok = diameter:start(),
  111:     try
  112:         ?util:run([[{[fun run/1, T], 30000} || T <- List]])
  113:     after
  114:         ok = diameter:stop()
  115:     end;
  116: 
  117: run(Group) ->
  118:     start(Group),
  119:     send(Group),
  120:     stop().
  121: 
  122: %% start/1
  123: 
  124: start(Group) ->
  125:     ok = diameter:start_service(?SERVER, ?SERVICE(?L(Group))),
  126:     ok = diameter:start_service(?CLIENT, ?SERVICE(?CLIENT)),
  127:     LRef = ?util:listen(?SERVER, tcp, [{length_errors, Group}]),
  128:     ?util:connect(?CLIENT,
  129:                   tcp,
  130:                   LRef,
  131:                   [{capabilities, [{'Origin-State-Id', origin(Group)}]}]).
  132: 
  133: %% stop/0
  134: 
  135: stop() ->
  136:     ok = diameter:remove_transport(?SERVER, true),
  137:     ok = diameter:remove_transport(?CLIENT, true),
  138:     ok = diameter:stop_service(?SERVER),
  139:     ok = diameter:stop_service(?CLIENT).
  140: 
  141: %% send/1
  142: 
  143: %% Server transport exits on messages of insuffient length.
  144: send(exit) ->
  145:     %% Transport exit is followed by failover but there's only one
  146:     %% transport to choose from.
  147:     {error, failover} = call(4);
  148: 
  149: %% Server transport receives messages of insufficient length.
  150: send(handle) ->
  151:     %% Message Length too large: diameter_tcp flushes the request
  152:     %% when no additional bytes arrive.
  153:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?INVALID_MESSAGE_LENGTH}
  154:         = call(4),
  155:     %% Another request answered as it should.
  156:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  157:         = call(0),
  158:     %% Message Length conveniently small: the trailing optional
  159:     %% Origin-State-Id isn't included in the received request.
  160:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  161:         = call(-12),
  162:     %% Server receives Origin-State-Id AVP as the first 12 bytes of
  163:     %% the next request: AVP <<Code:32, Flags:8, Len:24, Data:32>> is
  164:     %% interpreted as header <<Version:8, Len:24, Flags:8, Code:24,
  165:     %% ApplId: 32>>. In particular, the AVP Length 12 = 00001100 is
  166:     %% interpreted as Command Flags, so R=0 and the request is
  167:     %% interpreted as an unsolicited answer. Increase Message Length
  168:     %% to have the server receive all bytes sent thusfar.
  169:     {error, timeout}
  170:         = call(12),
  171:     %% Another request answered as it should.
  172:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  173:         = call(0),
  174:     %% Shorten Message Length so much that that the server doesn't
  175:     %% receive the required Termination-Cause AVP.
  176:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?MISSING_AVP}
  177:         = call(-24);
  178: 
  179: %% Server transport discards message of insufficient length.
  180: send(discard) ->
  181:     %% First request times out when the server discards it but a
  182:     %% second succeeds since the transport remains up.
  183:     {error, timeout}
  184:         = call(4),
  185:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  186:         = call(0).
  187: 
  188: %% ===========================================================================
  189: 
  190: call(Delta) ->
  191:     diameter:call(?CLIENT,
  192:                   ?DICT,
  193:                   #diameter_base_STR
  194:                   {'Termination-Cause' = ?LOGOUT,
  195:                    'Auth-Application-Id' = ?DIAMETER_APP_ID_COMMON,
  196:                    'Origin-State-Id' = [7]},
  197:                   [{extra, [Delta]}]).
  198: 
  199: %% ===========================================================================
  200: %% diameter callbacks
  201: 
  202: %% peer_up/3
  203: 
  204: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  205:     State.
  206: 
  207: %% peer_down/3
  208: 
  209: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  210:     State.
  211: 
  212: %% pick_peer/5
  213: 
  214: pick_peer([Peer], _, ?CLIENT, _State, _Delta) ->
  215:     {ok, Peer}.
  216: 
  217: %% prepare_request/4
  218: 
  219: prepare_request(Pkt, ?CLIENT, {_Ref, Caps}, Delta) ->
  220:     {send, resize(Delta, prepare(Pkt, Caps))}.
  221: 
  222: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req0} = Pkt, Caps) ->
  223:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  224:                    origin_realm = {OR, DR}}
  225:         = Caps,
  226:     Req = Req0#diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH),
  227:                                  'Origin-Host' = OH,
  228:                                  'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  229:                                  'Destination-Realm' = DR},
  230:     diameter_codec:encode(?DICT, Pkt#diameter_packet{msg = Req}).
  231: 
  232: resize(0, Pkt) ->
  233:     Pkt;
  234: resize(Delta, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin} = Pkt) ->
  235:     Pkt#diameter_packet{bin = resize(Delta, Bin)};
  236: 
  237: resize(Delta, <<V, Len:24, T/binary>>) ->
  238:     <<V, (Len + Delta):24, T/binary>>.
  239: 
  240: %% handle_answer/5
  241: 
  242: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer, _Delta) ->
  243:     Pkt#diameter_packet.msg.
  244: 
  245: %% handle_error/5
  246: 
  247: handle_error(Reason, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer, _Delta) ->
  248:     {error, Reason}.
  249: 
  250: %% handle_request/3
  251: 
  252: handle_request(Pkt, ?SERVER, {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  253:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  254:                    origin_realm = {OR, _},
  255:                    origin_state_id = {_,[Id]}}
  256:         = Caps,
  257:     answer(origin(Id),
  258:            Pkt,
  259:            #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  260:                               'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH),
  261:                               'Origin-Host' = OH,
  262:                               'Origin-Realm' = OR}).
  263: 
  264: answer(Group, #diameter_packet{errors = Es}, Ans) ->
  265:     answer(Group, Es, Ans);
  266: 
  267: %% No errors: just answer.
  268: answer(_, [], Ans) ->
  269:     {reply, Ans};
  270: 
  271: %% Otherwise an invalid length should only reach the callback if
  272: %% length_errors = handle.
  273: answer(Group, [RC|_], Ans)
  274:   when RC == ?INVALID_MESSAGE_LENGTH, Group == handle;
  275:        RC /= ?INVALID_MESSAGE_LENGTH ->
  276:     {reply, Ans}.
